alert.note: Alert for Cleburne; White (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 03 at 5:42AM CST until March 03 at 7:45AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern White County in central Arkansas... Cleburne County in north central Arkansas... * Until 745 AM CST. * At 542 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated additional thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Heber Springs, Fairfield Bay, Beebe, Greers Ferry, Quitman, Rose Bud, Higden, Gravel Hill, Antioch in White County, Hopewell in Cleburne County, Pearson, Eden Isle, Dam Site Marina, Sidon, Joy, Wilburn, Brownsville, Romance, Ida and Narrows Marina. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
